intro: Heterotoma riparia, commonly known as the river sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils along riverbanks and coastal areas. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow and linear, adapted to withstand saline and arid conditions. Heterotoma riparia is well-suited to coastal and riparian environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
